perturbation.original_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full upon signing of this agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Contribution by Sponsor: In consideration for the right to sponsor the Kaya Fest and to be acknowledged by Fruit of Life Productions LLC., as a Promoter of the event during the term of this Agreement, Sponsor agrees to contract with Fruit of Life Productions LLC., for the amount of $250,000.00 to be paid in full within 10 days of signing of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states payment is due 'upon signing,' while the modified text introduces a 10-day grace period. This contradiction creates uncertainty about the exact payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: Terms and Termination: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until April 30, 2018 at 11:59pm.
perturbation.changed_text: Terms and Termination: The term of this agreement will begin on April 1, 2018 and continue until April 30, 2018 at 11:59pm. This agreement will automatically renew for an additional year unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to April 30, 2018.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly defines a one-month term. The added sentence introduces an automatic renewal clause with a 30-day notice requirement *before* the initial termination date, creating a conflict. If no notice is given before April 1st, does the contract automatically renew, even though the original term was clearly defined?

perturbation.original_text: Assignment: This Agreement, or the rights granted under it, may not be assigned transferred or sublicense by either party without the express prior written consent of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: Assignment: This Agreement, or the rights granted under it, may not be assigned transferred or sublicense by either party without the express prior written consent of the other party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Sponsor may assign this Agreement to a wholly-owned subsidiary without the Promoter's consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause prohibits assignment without consent. The added sentence creates an exception for the Sponsor to assign to a wholly-owned subsidiary, contradicting the initial restriction and causing confusion. It is not clear which clause takes precedence.
